Title: Microservices Are a Tax Your Startup Probably Can‚Äôt Afford
Description:
Why splitting your codebase too early can quietly destroy your team‚Äôs velocity ‚Äî and what to do instead.
In a startup, your survival depends on how quickly you can iterate, ship features, and deliver value to end-users. This is where the foundational architecture of your startup plays a big role; additionally, things like your tech stack and choice of programming language directly affect your team‚Äôs velocity. The wrong architecture, especially premature microservices, can substantially hurt productivity and contribute to missed goals in delivering software.

Title: Why Your Lambda Functions Need a Structural Makeover
Description:
Hi, I'm James Eastham, In this video, I'll share how to structure your Lambda functions for modularity and longevity using Ports and Adapters architecture. 

Avoid the pitfalls of monolithic code by separating business logic from infrastructure concerns.

Learn why a clean separation of concerns is vital for maintainable and adaptable code, regardless of whether you're using .NET, Node.js, Python, or Rust. By the end, you'll understand how to make your code more testable, scalable, and adaptable to changes in deployment environments.

00:00 Introduction and Initial Setup
00:56 Common Mistakes in Lambda Functions
01:17 Importance of Modularity and Clean Code
01:52 Introduction to Ports and Adapters
02:50 Driving and Driven Adapters Explained
03:56 Applying Ports and Adapters in Lambda
04:43 Practical Example: Recipe API
06:03 Refactoring for Better Code Design
09:12 Benefits of Clean Code and Modularity
11:14 Conclusion and Final Thoughts
